prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: What are Stefan's true and genuine thoughts, feelings, the nature of his emotions and feelings, and intentions towards his wife, Suzanne?

Please do not immediately assume that I'm looking for romantic inclinations. I am not certain what, if any, feelings exist, and what those feelings are deemed to be. That is the reason I have drawn up the chart, is to get a true determination. So, any biasing towards romantic inclination or otherwise should be removed, and ensure that this chart is interpreted fully and objectively to discern the true nature of the questied's feelings, thoughts, and intentions towards his wife.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a methodical extraction of all chart data relevant to a horary analysis of Stefan’s true thoughts, feelings, emotions, and intentions toward Suzanne. This catalog is based strictly on the provided horary chart details and follows horary principles.

• Fundamental Planetary Data (with Degrees, Signs, and Notations)
 – Sun: 0°17′ Pisces
 – Moon: 8°16′ Scorpio
 – Mercury: 7°46′ Pisces
 – Venus: 8°26′ Aries
 – Mars: 17°11′ Cancer (Retrograde)
 – Jupiter: 11°37′ Gemini
 – Saturn: 19°26′ Pisces
 – Uranus: 23°25′ Taurus
 – Neptune: 28°31′ Pisces
 – Pluto: 2°35′ Aquarius
 – North Node: 28°55′ Pisces (Retrograde)
 – Chiron: 20°08′ Aries
 – Ascendant: 16°29′ Gemini
 – Midheaven (MC): 20°21′ Aquarius
 – Imum Coeli (IC): 20°21′ Leo

• Major Aspects (with Orbs)
 – Chiron Sextile MC (orb: 0°)
 – MC Opposition IC (orb: 0°)
 – Neptune Conjunction North Node (orb: 0°)
 – Chiron Trine IC (orb: 0°)
 – Moon Trine Mercury (orb: 1°)
 – Mars Trine Saturn (orb: 2°)
 – Venus Sextile Jupiter (orb: 3°)
 – Uranus Square IC (orb: 3°)
 – Uranus Square MC (orb: 3°)
 – Saturn Square Ascendant (orb: 3°)
 – Mars Square Chiron (orb: 3°)
 – Ascendant Sextile IC (orb: 4°)
 – Chiron Sextile Ascendant (orb: 4°)
 – Pluto Sextile North Node (orb: 4°)
 – Saturn Sextile Uranus (orb: 4°)
 – Mercury Square Jupiter (orb: 4°)
 – Ascendant Trine MC (orb: 4°)
 – Uranus Sextile Neptune (orb: 5°)
 – Jupiter Conjunction Ascendant (orb: 5°)
 – Mars Sextile Uranus (orb: 6°)
 – Venus Sextile Pluto (orb: 6°)
 – Moon Square Pluto (orb: 6°)
 – Sun Square Uranus (orb: 7°)
 – Sun Trine Moon (orb: 8°)

• Configurational Patterns
 – T-Square
  • Involves:
   – MC at 20° Aquarius
   – Uranus at 23° Taurus
   – IC at 20° Leo
 – Yod
  • Involves:
   – Moon at 8° Scorpio
   – Jupiter at 11°37′ Gemini
   – Venus at 8°26′ Aries
 – Cradle
  • Involves:
   – MC at 20° Aquarius
   – IC at 20° Leo
   – Ascendant at 16°29′ Gemini
   – Chiron at 20°08′ Aries

• Special Chart Features
 – Moon in waning gibbous phase
 – Bucket-shaped chart configuration
 – Dominance of the Water element among the inner planets
 – Inner planets are absent from Earth signs
 – Dominance of the Mutable mode among the inner planets
 – Majority of planets positioned in the top left quadrant
 – Jupiter is in a rising position
 – IC located on the Nadir
 – Sextile is the most prevalent aspect (total of 9 occurrences)
 – Neptune in Pisces is in its rulership

• House Placements (Key Houses for Horary Indications)
 – 1st House (Ascendant): Starts at 16° Gemini (Ascendant at 16°29′ Gemini)
 – 2nd House: Starts at 11° Cancer (contains Mars)
 – 3rd House: Starts at 0° Leo
 – 4th House (IC): Starts at 20° Leo (IC at 20°21′ Leo)
 – 5th House: Starts at 20° Virgo
 – 6th House: Starts at 6° Scorpio (contains Moon)
 – 7th House: Starts at 16° Sagittarius
 – 8th House: Starts at 11° Capricorn
 – 9th House: Starts at 0° Aquarius (contains Pluto)
 – 10th House (MC): Starts at 20° Aquarius (contains Sun, Mercury, Saturn)
 – 11th House: Starts at 20° Pisces (contains Venus, Neptune, North Node, Chiron)
 – 12th House: Starts at 6° Taurus (contains Jupiter, Uranus)

These are the extracted data points and configurations from the horary chart as it pertains to the question regarding Stefan’s genuine thoughts, emotions, and intentions toward Suzanne. This data should serve as the foundation for further detailed interpretation.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is the second-layer data extraction required for a horary analysis focused on Stefan’s genuine thoughts, emotions, and intentions toward Suzanne. This step isolates the key chart elements relevant to this inquiry, grouping them into factors for personal, relational, and underlying subconscious dynamics.

A. Primary Significators for Stefan and His Relationship to Suzanne

 • Questioner–Stefan Indicators:
  – Ascendant at 16°29′ Gemini (represents Stefan’s personal stance and immediate outlook)
  – Mercury at 7°46′ Pisces (indicates thought processes and internal communications)
  – Moon at 8°16′ Scorpio (denotes emotional nature and instinctive responses)
  – Mars at 17°11′ Cancer, retrograde (carries drives, potential internal conflict regarding desires)

 • Spousal/Relationship Indicators (Suzanne):
  – 7th House begins at 16° Sagittarius (Suzanne’s representation in the relationship)
  – Ruler of the 7th House (Sagittarius) is Jupiter, positioned at 11°37′ Gemini in the 12th House (points to hidden, subconscious dynamics influencing the marital bond)

B. Key Aspects Affecting Thoughts, Feelings, and Intentions

 • Intellectual and Emotional Connection:
  – Moon trine Mercury (orb: 1°) suggests a harmonious link between feeling and thought
  – Sun in Pisces (0°17′) trine Moon (orb: 8°) lends sensitivity but also a fluid nature in emotional expression

 • Conflicts, Tensions, and Hidden Dynamics:
  – Moon square Pluto (orb: 6°) indicates powerful, transformative emotional undercurrents, possibly hinting at buried resentments or psychological intensity
  – Mars (constituting personal drive, though retrograde) forming a square with Chiron (orb: 3°) points to internal struggle with personal wounds in how he drives or asserts himself
  – Mercury square Jupiter (orb: 4°) can denote tension between his idealistic thoughts and practical considerations

 • Influences of Idealism and Disruption:
  – Sun square Uranus (orb: 7°) brings unpredictable or disruptive energy into his conscious self-expression
  – Neptune in its rulership in Pisces, along with Mercury and the Sun in Pisces, may cast an idealistic or even illusory filter over his perceptions
  – Saturn trine Mars (orb: 2°) adds a stabilizing or disciplined quality in the midst of emotional and drive-related tension

C. Configurational Patterns of Note

 • T-Square:
  – Formed by the MC in Aquarius (20°21′), Uranus in Taurus (23°25′), and IC in Leo (20°21′)
    • This configuration indicates tension between his public persona (MC) and his foundational life/inner emotional state (IC) with Uranus’s disruptive influence

 • Yod:
  – Involving the Moon in Scorpio (8°16′), Venus in Aries (8°26′), and Jupiter in Gemini (11°37′)
    • The Yod channels energy that may concentrate inner conflict or fate around his emotional (Moon), affective/relational (Venus), and expansive (Jupiter) areas

 • Cradle:
  – Composed of the MC (20°21′ Aquarius), IC (20°21′ Leo), Ascendant (16°29′ Gemini), and Chiron (20°08′ Aries)
    • This grouping underscores a pattern of nurturing dynamics that are also marked by a deeper wounded energy (Chiron)

D. House Influences and Positional Emphasis

 • 10th House (MC) in Aquarius houses the Sun, Mercury, and Saturn—indicating that Stefan’s public expressions and overall persona are immersed in the mutable, intuitive qualities of Pisces and the innovative tendencies of Aquarius.
 • 11th House in Pisces (containing Venus, Neptune, North Node, and Chiron) points to idealistic, sometimes nebulous desires and influences that can color his relational expectations.
 • 12th House contains Jupiter (ruler of the 7th) and Uranus, suggesting that the marital dynamic and his view of Suzanne may be subject to hidden pressures, subconscious insights, or unexpected changes.

E. Summary of Isolated Data Points for Further Interpretation

 1. Stefan’s personal thought and feeling indicators (Ascendant, Mercury, Moon, Mars) manifest significant fluidity, intuitive insight, and internal conflict.
 2. The relational significator—Jupiter as ruler of the 7th—is in the 12th House, pointing to subconscious or concealed influences in his marital perception.
 3. Assertive, disruptive, and transformative aspects (Moon square Pluto; Sun square Uranus; Mars square Chiron) imply that while there are deep emotional currents present, these might also be fraught with internal contradictions or unspoken tension.
 4. Configurational patterns (T-Square, Yod, Cradle) collectively emphasize a dynamic interplay between public identity and inner emotional life, with notable influences from idealism, subconscious drives, and unresolved personal wounds.

This detailed extraction of the key chart components provides the foundation required to move into an objective, step-by-step interpretation of what Stefan’s genuine thoughts, feelings, and intentions toward Suzanne may be. Further interpretation will integrate these elements strictly by horary principles.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Based on the extracted data and following strict horary principles, these are the objective findings regarding Stefan’s genuine internal dynamics and his intentions toward Suzanne:

1. Personal and Psychological Indicators
 • The Ascendant in Gemini and Mercury in Pisces show a mutable and sensitive mental approach, suggesting that Stefan processes his thoughts through intuition rather than rigid logic.
 • The Moon in Scorpio indicates deep, sometimes hidden emotional currents. Its square to Pluto reveals transformative emotional intensity, possibly involving suppressed resentments or buried issues.
 • Mars in Cancer, especially in retrograde motion, points to internal conflict in the expression of drive or passion. This retrogression implies that his assertive impulses are often hindered by internal pressures or unresolved emotional wounds.
 • The Sun in Pisces, supported by its trine to the Moon, hints at a compassionate, fluid self-expression that may mask complex layers of internal struggle and dissonance.

2. Relationship and Marital Indicators
 • The 7th House cusp in Sagittarius is the classical marker for Suzanne’s presence. Its ruler, Jupiter, is situated in Gemini in the 12th House. This placement suggests that Stefan’s perception of his marital relationship may be influenced by subconscious or hidden factors. There is an idealistic quality here, but also a tendency toward internalized conflict that is not immediately evident on the surface.
 • The configuration of the T-Square (MC in Aquarius, Uranus in Taurus, and IC in Leo) stresses tension between his public self and his private, emotional foundation. This dynamic contributes to a disjoint between how he appears outwardly and what he harbors internally regarding the marriage.

3. Aspects Reflecting Internal Dynamics
 • The Moon’s harmonious aspect with Mercury (trine, orb 1°) confirms that, despite hidden turmoil, there is a fluid communication between his emotional and intellectual realms. This might allow him periods of clarity about his inner state.
 • However, the Moon square Pluto underscores that transformative, possibly disruptive, forces are at work, suggesting that emotional upheavals or power struggles could emerge, whether consciously recognized or not.
 • Mercury’s square to Jupiter may cause his idealistic or expansive thoughts to conflict with the practical or mundane aspects of the relationship, resulting in internal cognitive dissonance.

4. Patterns and Configurations
 • The Yod involving the Moon, Venus, and Jupiter hints at a karmic or fated tension focused on his emotional and affective realms. This pattern channels energy that forces him to address underlying conflicts in how he experiences and expresses affection, even if such feelings are not straightforwardly romantic in intent.
 • The Cradle configuration (MC, IC, Ascendant, and Chiron) highlights a nurturing element interwoven with deep-seated wounds. Chiron’s involvement suggests that past emotional injuries are influencing his present attitudes and may manifest as hesitancy or defensive behavior in his marital interactions.

5. Overall Interpretation
 • Stefan’s thoughts and feelings toward Suzanne are complex, marked by depth and internal contradiction. While there is a capacity for empathy and intuitive understanding (as indicated by the Pisces influences), this is counterbalanced by potent undercurrents of emotional intensity and unresolved pain (Moon square Pluto, Mars retrograde, Mars square Chiron).
 • His intentions toward Suzanne may not align with an overtly romantic or purely idealized connection; instead, they are tinted by an internal struggle between idealism and hidden emotional burdens. The placement of Jupiter in the 12th House (ruler of the 7th) reinforces that much of his relational sentiment operates below the level of conscious awareness.
 • The combined influence of intellectual fluidity (Gemini), emotional turbulence (Scorpio and retrograde Mars), and transformative aspects (Pluto’s involvement) suggests that Stefan is in an ongoing process of internal recalibration. His genuine perspective might involve simultaneously valuing the relationship’s emotional depth while being wary of its inherent vulnerabilities and his own discomfort in expressing demanding, assertive feelings.

Confidence in these observations is moderate to high, given the precise degrees and established horary principles applied. Further contextual details or follow-up inquiries might refine the nuances of this interpretation.

Please advise on any specific area you wish to delve into further.
